Portal 1 with a better story. Dialogue is even more funny, and puzzles are just as well designed. Only nitpick: the middle portion of the game experiments with open environments, which I feel doesn't really suit the game. Still very highly recommended. I suggest that you play both games and not just 2.

A great game from Valve, one of the best plot in the history of games. Portal 2 takes palce years after events in Portal 1, and i my opinion it's a good way of finishing the story of Aperture Science. In Portal 2 we have a lot more fun, much more content, some explaination of the begining of Aperture Science. I think that if you play it, you would not regret it.

中年失业模拟器When a GLADOS lose his body
You are a 35-years-old man who struggling in a huge chamber, the GLADOS is pressing you to test day and night. Suddenly ,you got betrayed! Without cubes, you have to test (15000 P /chamber) and place 2 portals! How can you do that? Come on ! Find potato and save your GLADOS!

How can one not love this game. The story is hillarious, unpredictable, never boring and well told. The puzzle solving messes with your 3D imagination in a way you never thought of. Multiple times. In Co-op mode you need to work well together to master each chamber. Awesome!

If you haven't played this game, you're doing yourself a great disservice. I almost busted a gut over how funny it is--and clever, too! The puzzles are challenging, but not so challenging you want to quit in a fit of rage. I found myself mulling over the more difficult ones at work and coming up with the solution to try once I got home.

If anything, just get this game for GLaDOS who will soothe over your fears with threats to your life and other relaxing, reassuring audio. And J.K. Simmons.
